page.title: 06COMMUNITY POLICE
page.content: Staverton Community policeman is P.C. Williams. He was a milkman before he trained to be a policeman. His training took fifteen weeks. Before becoming a Community Policeman he had helped to train police dogs, including training them to follow the trail of a particular person, perhaps a burglar. His job is to get to know the area and the people who live and work in it and to help people in trouble. Sometimes, he has had to break into houses if people have been taken ill and cannot open the door. When he is on night duty, from midnight to eight o'clock in the morning, he has to check that all the property is safe. Sometimes he is sent away to help deal with the riots at football matches in Swindon. Holt is served by a group of similar officers know as the Rural Team.
